description.narrative: The proposed project development objective is to provide a more efficient response to emergencies, urgencies, and associated help line requests from the population of Lima Metropolitan area and Callao.

condition.narrative: Schedule 2, Section I. A. 2. (a) of the Loan Agreement. The Borrower shall create and maintain, throughout Project implementation,a unit within PRONATEL (the “PIU”) with functions and responsibilities acceptable to the Bank, and staffed with adequate fiduciary,administrative and technical personnel as set forth in the Operational Manual.

Schedule 2, Section I. A. 2. (b) of the Loan Agreement. The Borrower shall not later than ninety (90) days after Effective Date,ensure that a procurement specialist is hired to work full time within the PIU, all under terms of reference acceptable to the Bank.

Schedule 2, Section I. A. 3. of the Loan Agreement. The Borrower shall establish, by no later than sixty (60) days after EffectiveDate, and thereafter operate and maintain throughout the period of implementation of Project activities, a Steering Committee (the“SC”), which committee shall have membership, functions, and competencies acceptable to the Bank as defined in the OperationalManual.

Schedule 2, Section I. B. 1 (B) of the Loan Agreement. The Borrower, through PRONATEL, shall exercise its rights and carry out itsobligations under the Cooperation Agreement in such manner as to protect the interests of the Borrower and the Bank and toaccomplish the purposes of the Loan. Except as the Bank shall otherwise agree, the Borrower, through PRONATEL, shall not assign,amend, abrogate, waive, terminate or fail to enforce the Cooperation Agreement or any of its provisions.

Schedule 2, Section I. B. 1 (a) of the Loan Agreement. To facilitate the carrying out of the Project, the Borrower, throughPRONATEL, shall enter into an agreement with the First Response Units (the Cooperation Agreement), under terms, and conditionsacceptable to the Bank including, inter alia, the First Response Units responsibilities, in the Project in accordance with therelevant provisions of this Agreement.

Schedule 2, Section I. C.1 of the Loan Agreement. The Borrower, through PRONATEL, shall carry out the Project in accordance withthe provisions of a manual (the Operational Manual), satisfactory to the Bank, which shall include, inter alia: (i) theorganizational structure of the Project, including the structure and terms of reference of personnel in charge of theimplementation of the Project; (ii) the structure and functions of the SC; (iii) the procedures for the carrying out, monitoringand evaluation of the Project; (iv) the indicators for Project monitoring and evaluation; (v) the Project procurement and financialmanagement requirements and procedures; and, (vi) the Project's chart of accounts and internal controls.

Schedule 2, Section I. D. 1 of the Loan Agreement. The Borrower, through PRONATEL, shall ensure that the Project is carried out inaccordance with the Environmental and Social Standards, in a manner acceptable to the Bank.

Schedule 2, Section I. D. 2 of the Loan Agreement. Without limitation upon the Covenant described in Schedule 2, Section I. D. 1 ofthe Loan Agreement, the Borrower, through PRONATEL, shall ensure that the Project is implemented in accordance with theEnvironmental and Social Commitment Plan (“ESCP”), in a manner acceptable to the Bank. To this end, the Borrower, through PRONATEL,shall ensure that: (a) the measures and actions specified in the ESCP are implemented with due diligence and efficiency, and asfurther specified in the ESCP; (b) sufficient funds are available to cover the costs of implementing the ESCP; (c) policies,procedures and qualified staff are maintained to enable it to implement the ESCP, as further specified in the ESCP; and, (d) theESCP or any provision thereof, is not amended, revised or waived, except as the Bank shall otherwise agree in writing, as specifiedin the ESCP, and the Borrower, through PRONATEL, has, thereafter, disclosed the revised ESCP. In case of any inconsistenciesbetween the ESCP and the provisions of the Loan Agreement, the provisions of the Loan Agreement shall prevail.

Schedule 2, Section I. D. 3 (a) of the Loan Agreement. The Borrower, through PRONATEL, shall take all measures necessary on itspart to collect, compile, and furnish to the Bank through regular reports, with the frequency specified in the ESCP, and promptlyin a separate report or reports, if so requested by the Bank, information on the status of compliance with the ESCP, all suchreports in form and substance acceptable to the Bank, setting out, inter alia: (i) the status of implementation of the ESCP; (ii)conditions, if any, which interfere or threaten to interfere with the implementation of the ESCP; and, (iii) corrective andpreventive measures taken or required to be taken to address such conditions.

Schedule 2, Section I. D. 3 (b) of the Loan Agreement. The Borrower, through PRONATEL, shall promptly notify the Bank of anyincident or accident related to or having an impact on the Project which has, or is likely to have, a significant adverse effect onthe environment, the affected communities, the public or workers, in accordance with the ESCP, the instruments referenced thereinand the Environmental and Social Standards.

Schedule 2, Section I. D. 4 of the Loan Agreement. The Borrower, through PRONATEL, shall maintain and publicize the availability ofa grievance mechanism, in form and substance satisfactory to the Bank, to hear and determine fairly and in good faith allcomplaints raised in relation to the Project, and take all measures necessary to implement the determinations made by suchmechanism in a manner satisfactory to the Bank.

Schedule 2, Section IV. of the Loan Agreement. The Borrower, through MTC, shall, no later than twenty (20) months from Effectivedate, or before the implementation of the 911 Platform, approve the necessary adjustments to the legal framework regardinggeolocation requirements that shall include the obligation of mobile operators to share real time data and transfer the geolocationdata to the 911 Emergency Response System.
